intro: Halanthium roseum, commonly known as the red root sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Halanthium roseum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
